title: (x) Brokeback Riders wild west type - hand drawn (various digital counterparts) {gang}
content:
Any help would be greatly appreciated, especially the font used on “Brokeback” and “Dub Mix”. THANKS IN ADVANCE!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [riders.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052824/http:/typophile.com/files/riders.jpg) | 254.52 KB |

 [‹ (x) "Krop creative & tech jobs" script - Freehand 575 {Tim D}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052824/http:/typophile.com/node/32204 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Serif face used in menu bar - Century Schoolbook {Niall Moran} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052824/http:/typophile.com/node/32205 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content:
Obviously hand rendered but for sources of inspiration you could look at  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tuscan](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052824/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tuscan "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tuscan")

Tim

Brokeback:Pepperwood  
Riders:Rosewood  
Constant Sorrrow:Mesquite  
Club Mix 6.03: (I’ve seen this one, but I can’t remember which one it is.)  
Dub Mix:Ponderosa  
6.05:Zebrawood

All can be found here: [Adobe Woodcuts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014052824/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/S/S_woodcut.html?newsample=DUB+MIX&=View)
I was shooting for a 100% ID there Stephen, but I missed it by a nose. Thanks, I actually wouldn’t have found that one on my own.
